columns.text: In this scenario, we're financing a house for $225,000 over 30 years at a $1,113.46 monthly payment and a 4.3% APR. The seller provided the option of paying a point equivalent to 1% of the loan amount to reduce the APR to 4.05%. We'll determine the maximum amount of points spent selling the house after eight years to buy another.

We will consider the following details from the problem in determining the maximum point to spend:

| Particulars       |            |
|-------------------|------------|
| House loan amount | $225,000   |
| Monthly payment | $1,113.46   |
| Original rate     | 4.30%      |
| Reduced rate     | 4.05%      |
| Loan period            | 30 years |
First, we'll compute the remaining balance of the loan using the initial APR of 4.30% after the eight years of purchasing it since we're selling the house after eight years of ownership.

We will use the present value annuity computation to calculate the loan's remaining balance on the eight-year. The following formula can be used to calculate the present value of an annuity:

$$ \begin{aligned}
PVA &=C\times\dfrac{1-\dfrac{1}{\left(1+r\right)^t}}{r}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$PVA$, which means the present value of an annuity\
$C$, which represent the periodic payment\
$r$, which refers to the rate\
$t$, which symbolizes the period

Next, identify the period to be used. Since we wish to line in the house for only eight years and pay the remaining balance, we will subtract the eight years from the 30-year term and multiply it by 12 as the periodic payment is monthly due.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Period} &= \left(30-8\right)\times12
\\[5pt]
&= 22\times12
\\[5pt]
&=264
\end{aligned}$$

Thus, the period we will consider is 264.
Next, determine the total discounted amount if the rate is lowered to 4.05%, supposed we spent a particular point.

This calculation will combine the present value of the loan's remaining balance after eight years with the present value of the loan if the rate is reduced to 4.05%.

The combined value is then subtracted from the loan amount to determine the total discounted amount from the loan.

To compute and combine the present value of the loan at 4.05% and the present value of the loan's remaining balance after eight years, we'll apply the formula below.

$$ \begin{aligned}
PVA &=C\times\dfrac{1-\dfrac{1}{\left(1+r\right)^t}}{r}+\dfrac{\text{Balance after eight years}}{\left(1+r\right)^t}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$PVA$, which means the present value of an annuity\
$C$, which represent the periodic amount\
$r$, which refers to the rate\
$t$, which symbolizes the period

Next, we'll discount our calculation for eight years because the loan is expected to be paid off in eight years. We will, however, convert the year into months again because the periodic payment is made on a monthly basis.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Period} &= 8\times12
\\[5pt]
&=96
\end{aligned}$$

Therefore, the period we will consider in our computation is 96.

Let's now calculate the amount discounted from the loan if we pay a particular point.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Amount Discounted} &= \$231,824.96-\$225,000
\\[5pt]
&= \boxed{\$3,574.92}
\end{aligned}$$

Therefore, the total amount discounted if we pay a particular point is \$3,574.92.
Finally, we'll use the total amount discounted from the alternative option to figure out how many points we should spend to reduce the loan's APR rate from 4.30% to 4.05%.

We will divide the amount discounted over the loan amount and multiply the result by 100. Hence we will use the following formula:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Maximum Point to Spend} &= \dfrac{\text{Amount Discounted}}{\text{Loan amount}}\times100
\end{aligned}$$

Let's now calculate the maximum percentage of points we can buy.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Maximum Point to Spend} &= \dfrac{\$6,824.96}{\$225,000}\times100
\\[10pt]
&= \boxed{{\text{\bf1.59 Points}}}
\end{aligned}$$

**As a result, if we want to sell the house after eight years, the maximum point we can spend to lower the APR is 1.59 points, as shown in our estimate.**

To summarize, if we aim to sell the house after eight years, we should spend the maximum number of points of 1.59 to reduce the APR to 4.05%. We arrived at the number of points by first calculating the total discounted amount, including the present value of the loan's remaining balance after eight years if the APR is reduced.
